title: How to Draw a Frog

steps.headline: Start by drawing an elongated shape and then make its left side pointy.
steps.description: Then add two small circles on the uppermost right part of the shape.

steps.headline: Draw its hind legs and fronts legs next.
steps.description: Sketch a bumpy line for its nostrils and mouth.

steps.headline: Add in details such as his eyes, his dimpled grin and his stomach.
Add a final touch; small circles to illustrate the freckled skin of the frog.
Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker and then clean up the penciled sketch with an eraser.
Color it in and you’re done.
steps.description: Use colors such as dark green, yellow-green and cream or white.

steps.headline: Draw two horizontally-elongated ovals, which overlap each other.
steps.description: The top oval is smaller compared to the other.

steps.headline: Add two rings on the left and right sides of the upper oval.
steps.description: This will be for the frog’s big eyes.

steps.headline: Draw the details of the frog’s face using curves.
Draw the details for the frog’s limbs using curves.
Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.
Draw an elongated oval, which is tilted in the upper right direction.
steps.description: Draw a circle which overlaps the upper part of the oval.

steps.headline: Draw the hind legs, using straight lines to provide the framework.
steps.description: Draw this connected to the rear part of the frog.

steps.headline: Draw the front limbs.
steps.description: Use straight lines connected to the middle part of the oval.

steps.headline: Refine the head by using curved lines.
steps.description: Add details for the eyes, mouth, and nose.

steps.headline: Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.
Refine and color the drawing as you like!

text: Drawing a General Frog Start by drawing an elongated shape and then make its left side pointy. Then add two small circles on the uppermost right part of the shape. Draw its hind legs and fronts legs next. Sketch a bumpy line for its nostrils and mouth. Add in details such as his eyes, his dimpled grin and his stomach.  Add a final touch; small circles to illustrate the freckled skin of the frog.  Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker and then clean up the penciled sketch with an eraser.  Color it in and you’re done. Use colors such as dark green, yellow-green and cream or white. Drawing a Cartoon Frog Draw two horizontally-elongated ovals, which overlap each other. The top oval is smaller compared to the other. Add two rings on the left and right sides of the upper oval. This will be for the frog’s big eyes. Draw the details of the frog’s face using curves.  Draw the details for the frog’s limbs using curves. Draw the webbed feet. Refine the body using curves.  Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.  Color to your liking!  Drawing a Traditional Frog Draw an elongated oval, which is tilted in the upper right direction. Draw a circle which overlaps the upper part of the oval. Draw the hind legs, using straight lines to provide the framework. Draw this connected to the rear part of the frog. Draw the front limbs. Use straight lines connected to the middle part of the oval. Refine the head by using curved lines. Add details for the eyes, mouth, and nose. Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.  Refine and color the drawing as you like!
sentences: Drawing a General Frog Start by drawing an elongated shape and then make its left side pointy.
Then add two small circles on the uppermost right part of the shape.
Draw its hind legs and fronts legs next.
Sketch a bumpy line for its nostrils and mouth.
Add in details such as his eyes, his dimpled grin and his stomach.
Add a final touch; small circles to illustrate the freckled skin of the frog.
Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker and then clean up the penciled sketch with an eraser.
Color it in and you’re done.
Use colors such as dark green, yellow-green and cream or white.
Drawing a Cartoon Frog Draw two horizontally-elongated ovals, which overlap each other.
The top oval is smaller compared to the other.
Add two rings on the left and right sides of the upper oval.
This will be for the frog’s big eyes.
Draw the details of the frog’s face using curves.
Draw the details for the frog’s limbs using curves.
Draw the webbed feet.
Refine the body using curves.
Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.
Color to your liking!
Drawing a Traditional Frog Draw an elongated oval, which is tilted in the upper right direction.
Draw a circle which overlaps the upper part of the oval.
Draw the hind legs, using straight lines to provide the framework.
Draw this connected to the rear part of the frog.
Draw the front limbs.
Use straight lines connected to the middle part of the oval.
Refine the head by using curved lines.
Add details for the eyes, mouth, and nose.
Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.
Refine and color the drawing as you like!
